game.name: Back to the Future: Ep 1 - It's About Time
Age of Empires II: HD Edition

achievement.name: General
achievement.description: You have sought glory in ten single-player battles, fight on!

achievement.name: Centennial General
achievement.description: You have fought in one hundred single-player battles!

achievement.name: Millennial General
achievement.description: You have fought in one thousand single-player battles! Even Alexander the Great did not have your strength of will.

achievement.name: First Victory
achievement.description: Congratulations! You have achieved the first multi-player victory of many to come.

achievement.name: Fifty Victories
achievement.description: You have been victorious in fifty multi-player battles - you are a seasoned veteran and a worthy opponent!

achievement.name: Five Hundred Victories
achievement.description: It has probably been a long time since you stopped counting your battles and victories but your fans (and foes) will remember. This battle marks your five hundredth multi-player victory!

achievement.name: Loyal Ally
achievement.description: On this day you have fought in your tenth online battle! Let the town bell ring and the villagers rest from their labors that they may toast your good health and leadership. There will be many battles ahead, some victories, some defeats - but always lessons. Cheers and congratulations to you on this auspicious day!

achievement.name: Marking the First Hundred
achievement.description: Today is a day of glory! You have fought one hundred battles versus fierce online opponents. Three cheers for you - hip hip, HUZZAH! HUZZAH! HUZZAH!

achievement.name: Day of a Thousand Stories
achievement.description: Today is a day of great celebration! You have fought your one thousandth battle against online opponents. Order a feast! Make a toast to those who have defeated you as honorable teachers, make a toast to those foes you have defeated, and most of all a toast to your friends and allies who have supported you in your many campaigns.

achievement.name: One Hundred Random Maps
achievement.description: You are master of the random map - from the thrill of exploration, to the skillful deployment of your villages, to the razing of the enemy and driving them from your borders. Master of continents and oceans, your leadership is the stuff of song and legend!

achievement.name: Anytime, Anywhere
achievement.description: You have fought on every type of map, against every type of opponent in history. There may be those who will still stand against you, but they do so with respect. Huzzah!

achievement.name: The Quickening
achievement.description: With turbo your villagers will gather and build quickly - pay attention to your resources and idle villagers. Turbo will let you focus more on your mid-game strategic planning.

achievement.name: Gathering Speed
achievement.description: Now that you have played twenty games at turbo you probably have a feel for the pace and challenges. Focus on pushing your early attacks even earlier to surprise your enemy and interrupt their build momentum.

achievement.name: First Deathmatch
achievement.description: Deathmatch is a competition of fast decisions and instant action. It will hone your skills at pitched battle.

achievement.name: Deathmatch Master
achievement.description: Mastery of deathmatch is the ability to continuously make good decisions while building a sustainable economy under constant attacks. You have demonstrated that ability by playing 50 games.

achievement.name: Deathmatch Legend
achievement.description: After 300 battles if there is something to be learned in Deathmatch it is where to find opponents who will still agree to fight you. Congratulations!

achievement.name: A Taste of History
achievement.description: Each legendary leader has something to teach you, a tactic, a strategy, or an attitude - when you have fought their battles and studied their history you are taking steps to becoming a legendary leader yourself. Congratulations!

achievement.name: Twenty Scenarios
achievement.description: You have played your twentieth scenario, Congratulations! What will the historians write about your battles? Who were your greatest foes? Were you more cunning or more bold? Only time will tell.

achievement.name: Fifty Scenarios Completed
achievement.description: You have played fifty scenarios - Wonderful! Each conquered world reveals more lessons and more challenges ahead. All great leaders build their knowledge on the foundation of the stories of the legends that have gone before. Cheers to you!

achievement.name: King of the Hill
achievement.description: It isn’t taking the hill, it is holding it against all attackers that is the ultimate challenge. You are on your way.

achievement.name: Ten Hills
achievement.description: Life is short and brutal but legend is timeless, if you can master the strategies of King of the Hill you will be better prepared to take on anything that life throws at you. You have battled the hill ten times, this will certainly not be the last.

achievement.name: One Hundred Hills
achievement.description: You have claimed one hundred hilltops! The victor isn’t often the first one to the top, but the one that knows how to hold it once they are there. You have demonstrated that knowledge. Cheers to you!

achievement.name: Peaceful Builder
achievement.description: Wonder race is an exercise in building an economy quickly and efficiently - pay attention to balancing your economy and tasking those villagers and you will be victorious.

achievement.name: Fifth Wonder Race
achievement.description: By now you know the shortest path to building a wonder quickly - and how to build up your economy in a hurry. Focus on optimizing your gathering technologies and economy to surprise your opponents.

achievement.name: Wonder Race Mastery
achievement.description: For many, the Wonder Race is a good way to learn how to tune an economy and know the short path to the Wonder for any civilization. For you, the Wonder Race has its own appeal - a celebration of the empire builder’s art. Congratulations!

achievement.name: First Wonder Defense
achievement.description: Wonder Defense is an excellent way for any leader to build their skills. If you are defending then you must build your forces and reinforce your defensive structures quickly or attack offensively to reduce your opponent’s strength. Attackers must be coordinated if they hope to succeed.

achievement.name: Builder and Destroyer
achievement.description: Few things are so satisfying as seeing the enemy’s wonder in flames, or defending your wonder to the last unit. After ten Defend the Wonder battles you have certainly seen both. Cheers to you!

achievement.name: Wonder Defender
achievement.description: You have demonstrated mastery of the Defend the Wonder style. Cheers to you on your fiftieth challenge!

achievement.name: You were the Most Valuable Player!
achievement.description: You have earned your first MVP award. The Most Valuable Player in an Age of Empires II battle has the highest total buildings razed and enemy units killed on the team. Aggressive attacks and thorough elimination of enemy buildings will increase your chances of earning additional MVPs. Congratulations!

achievement.name: Rising Star
achievement.description: You have been selected for the Most Valuable Player award twenty times. You have demonstrated great skill in battle, and surpassed that by outperforming the other generals in your allegiance. You are definitely a rising star in this elite group. Congratulations!

achievement.name: Incredible Team Leader!
achievement.description: You have been selected for the Most Valuable Player award 100 times. You have demonstrated great skill in battle, and surpassed that by outperforming the other generals in your allegiance. You are definitely a rising star in this elite group. Congratulations!

achievement.description: You have led the Britons to victory ten times. Fight on!

achievement.name: Defender of the Britons
achievement.description: Master of the Longbow Archers, you have led the Britons to victory fifty times.

achievement.name: Hero of the Britons
achievement.description: You have led the Britons to victory one hundred times! Your name will be listed among their greatest heroes.

achievement.name: Random Civilization Victory
achievement.description: Choosing ‘Random’ for your civilization is a good boast. You are confidently telling the world that you can lead any civilization to victory! Cheers to you!

achievement.name: Random Civilization Twenty Five Victories
achievement.description: After twenty five victories, you have shown that you truly can lead any civilization to glory. You are truly a timeless commander! (And you can probably converse with villagers in several languages.)

achievement.name: Random Civilization One Hundred Victories
achievement.description: After a hundred victories playing random civilizations, your reputation is truly secure. Any civilization, any era, any map. Just bring it!

achievement.name: Foe of the Britons

achievement.name: Enemy of the Britons
achievement.description: In twenty conflicts you have defeated the Britons.

achievement.name: Conqueror of the Britons

achievement.name: Any Opponent
achievement.description: You have defeated random opponents twenty five times. Your legend grows greater with every victory. Congratulations!

achievement.name: Random Master
achievement.description: You have faced the random opponents and defeated them two hundred and fifty times. No civilization can find safety when they stand against you. Congratulations!

achievement.name: Master of all Civilizations
achievement.description: You have won at least one victory against every civilization in Age of Empires II.

achievement.name: Commander
achievement.description: You have killed over 500 units in a single session - your fame will spread from this point onward.

achievement.name: Emperor
achievement.description: You have killed over two thousand units in a single session. You are a legend to both allies and enemies.

achievement.name: Massacre
achievement.description: Two hundred of your units were lost in this conflict. Sadly, not every battle can be a sweeping victory where everyone returns to the feast table to boast of their skill. Sometimes, being a good general is about knowing when to throw everything against the enemy without reservation or hesitation. Today you know how that feels.

achievement.name: Protecting the Priests
achievement.description: The communication of ideas and religion was a powerful force that changed empires in the Middle Ages. Your conquest of 20 enemies in a single battle shows great skill at deploying and protecting the priests.

achievement.name: Master of Conversion
achievement.description: You have demonstrated mastery of the conversion strategies by converting over fifty enemy units in a single match.

achievement.name: No Backing Down
achievement.description: You razed 50 buildings in this campaign, your enemies will think twice before challenging you again.

achievement.name: Leave No Stone Unburned
achievement.description: In this campaign you razed over 100 buildings, your name is legend among your enemies.

achievement.name: Master of the Siege
achievement.description: No wall nor castle will stand in your way - you have clearly mastered the siege by razing over 250 buildings in one session.

achievement.name: Phoenix Rising
achievement.description: For some leaders, losing 50 buildings in a single session would be a crushing defeat - as long as you have wood and villagers you will carry on.

achievement.name: Live to Fight Another Day
achievement.description: Some leaders might aspire to build one hundred buildings in their entire reign. You lost that many this day and fought on valiantly. Stay strong!

achievement.name: Creation of your first Wonder of the World
achievement.description: You have constructed a wonder - a shining pinnacle of achievement for your civilization. It is a beacon of hope to people everywhere, and if defended - a legacy of that achievement to stand the test of time.

achievement.name: Five Wonders
achievement.description: Few leaders can master both the economy needed to construct a wonder, let alone build a strong military or alliances to defend it. As a veteran of Five Wonders you have demonstrated those skills.

achievement.name: Will Wonders Never Cease?
achievement.description: One Wonder is a pinnacle achievement for any ruler. You have constructed fifty Wonders of the World through your many campaigns through history. Clearly you are a master of building a strong economy and support structure. You are clearly a leader in the Age of Empires.

achievement.name: Century Castle Celebration
achievement.description: In your various campaigns through history you have constructed over one hundred castles.

achievement.name: One Thousand Castles
achievement.description: On this day you have created your thousand’th castle. Huzzah!

achievement.name: William Wallace Campaign Completed
achievement.description: “We come here with no peaceful intent, but ready for battle, determined to avenge our wrongs and set our country free. Let your masters come and attack us: we are ready to meet them beard to beard.” - (1297) William Wallace

achievement.name: Joan of Arc Campaign Completed
achievement.description: “Of the love or hatred God has for the English, I know nothing, but I do know that they will all be thrown out of France, except those who die there.” - Joan of Arc (Trial 1431)

achievement.name: Saladin Campaign Completed
achievement.description: By studying the campaigns of Salah al Din Yusuf ibn Ayyub, or

achievement.name: Genghis Khan Campaign Completed
achievement.description: His enemies know only the ruthlessness and speed of the great Khan’s conquests - but the greatest generals also know the tools of cooperation, alliance, and loyalty - these will serve you well in future campaigns.

achievement.name: Frederick Barbarossa Campaign Completed
achievement.description: In study of the campaigns of Frederick Barbarossa you learned the power of relics and of uniting an empire. Use this knowledge in your future conquests, but remember not to overextend yourself.

achievement.name: Attila the Hun Campaign Completed
achievement.description: Attila knew both great betrayal and great glory in his conquests against the Romans. Attila said: “It takes less courage to criticize the decisions of others than to stand by your own.” - Carry his example on to your other campaigns.

achievement.name: El Cid Campaign Completed
achievement.description: Throughout his conquests, El Cid was far more than a master at arms and noble, but was someone who could lead and unite the people. Even beyond his death, the legacy of his leadership was still more powerful than lesser rulers. Take his lessons with you on your own conquests.

achievement.name: Montezuma Campaign Completed
achievement.description: By following along with Cuauhtémoc in the battles against Cortés you have used alliance building and subtlety in addition to your skills in battle. Skillful use of forces and alliances can overcome the greatest odds. Remember these lessons in your next conquest.

achievement.name: Battles of the Conquerors Campaign Completed
achievement.description: Through study of these diverse battles and leaders you have mastered skills that will be useful in all of your future conquests. Fight with the piety of Charles Martel, the bravery of Alp Arslan, and the calculating tactics of Hideyoshi to ensure success in your campaigns.

achievement.name: Master of the Medieval World
achievement.description: You have successfully completed all of the story campaigns of Age of Empires II: The Age of Kings and Age of Empires II: The Conquerors Expansion. Successful leaders use many techniques to build their empires. Your careful study of the greatest of these men and women has given you new powers and abilities to build future empires.

achievement.name: Lightning General
achievement.description: You are an expert at the Turbo style, your decision-making under time pressure is legendary. Congratulations to you, Lightning General!

achievement.name: Hero of the Spanish
achievement.description: You have led the Spanish to victory one hundred times! Your name will be listed among their greatest heroes.

achievement.name: Legend among the Britons
achievement.description: One thousand victories commanding the Britons! You have mastered every strategy and tactic employed by the Britons and created several that will be named after you in the future. You are forever a legend.

achievement.name: Legend among the Franks
achievement.description: One thousand victories commanding the Franks! You have mastered every strategy and tactic employed by the Franks and created several that will be named after you in the future. You are forever a legend.

achievement.name: Legend among All
achievement.description: You have achieved victory with random civilizations a thousand times. Today you know everything. Very few generals can match you victory for victory, and even fewer when using a random civilization. Today is a day of triumph. Congratulations!

achievement.name: Humanity Victorious
achievement.description: Congratulations! You have defeated a single CPU opponent (at moderate difficulty or higher).

achievement.name: Two Challenging
achievement.description: Congratulations! You have singly defeated two CPU opponents (at moderate difficulty or higher).

achievement.name: Triumphant Three
achievement.description: Congratulations! You have singly defeated three CPU opponents (at moderate difficulty or higher).

achievement.name: Four Scored
achievement.description: Congratulations! You have singly defeated four CPU opponents (at moderate difficulty or higher).

achievement.name: Five Golden Victories
achievement.description: Congratulations! You have singly defeated five CPU opponents (at moderate difficulty or higher).

achievement.name: Superior Six
achievement.description: Congratulations! You have singly defeated six CPU opponents (at moderate difficulty or higher). Not many can claim this level of skill.

achievement.name: Seven Sealed Fates
achievement.description: Congratulations! You have singly defeated Seven CPU opponents (at moderate difficulty or higher). World champions will often play against seven CPU opponents on Hard difficulty as a warm-up before tournaments.

achievement.name: Power of Persuasion
achievement.description: Every successful conversion is doubly beneficial to your team - you remove an enemy attacker and increase your own forces. In your career you have successfully converted fifty units.

achievement.name: Embracing My Enemies
achievement.description: Over the span of your career, you have succesfully converted over five hundred of your enemies to your cause!

achievement.name: Converting the World
achievement.description: You have dedicated yourself to bringing your civilization's religion to your foes. Very few generals have the patience and wisdom to manage the priest units so effectively as you have. This is indeed a day of celebration - you have converted one thousand opposing units in your career.

achievement.name: Burned
achievement.description: You have crumbled your five hundredth building into rubble…and you are just getting warmed up. Congratulations!

achievement.name: Rubble Piles Everywhere
achievement.description: You have razed five thousand buildings in your long and illustrious military career! If your reputation went up as quickly as you take buildings down you would be known world-wide.

achievement.name: No Stone Left Standing
achievement.description: You have razed ten thousand buildings in your long and illustrious military career! You can unpack trebuchets in your sleep and you consider a dozen fire archers a pleasant introduction. You are a legend!

achievement.name: A Thousand Heaps of Rubble
achievement.description: In your career you have lost over one thousand buildings. Everything is a milestone, every win, every loss, and every building that falls. Great generals count their losses and learn from them.

achievement.name: Ten Thousand Ruins
achievement.description: In your career you have lost over ten thousand buildings. Buildings, like miles spent on horseback are excruciating at first but just mark the passage of time before long. If you celebrate with a cake, just put one candle on it and start working on your next ten thousand.

achievement.name: Time to Stop Counting Buildings
achievement.description: Sure, generals say that every unit lost is mourned and every building razed is avenged - but after fifty thousand even the most obsessive counter gives up. You have seen civilizatons rise and fall endlessly - it is time to stop counting the buildings. Congratulations that you persevere, mighty leader.

achievement.name: Hosted First Game
achievement.description: You hosted a multiplayer game for the first time!

achievement.name: Alaric Campaign Completed
achievement.description: Through toil and perseverance, you have found a new home for Alaric's people, showing even mighty Rome that the Goths are a force to be reckoned with. Use your migratory skills and resilience to find a new home, recover, and succeed in your future aims even when the present looks bleak.

achievement.name: Dracula Campaign Completed
achievement.description: Vlad Dracula was a harsh, sometimes cruel ruler, but one could not argue the success of his methods. The only man of his time able to stand against the might of the Ottomans, Vlad showed that patriotism, charisma, and proper tactics could overcome all odds. Vlad also made a point to be strict but fair. Remember that advice when ruling your empire.

achievement.name: Bari Campaign Completed
achievement.description: The Nautikos family valued its home greatly, and its family history and heritage instilled a drive in its heirs to bring glory to their house. Their exploits, though somewhat forgotten, are a source of pride to their descendants. That pride is a fine attribute, but it is best tempered with prudence and ethic. Take that advice on your future conquests.

achievement.name: Sforza Campaign Completed
achievement.description: Rising from a lowly soldier to Duke of Milan, Sforza did more than make his father’s spirit proud. Use the traits of military leadership and tactics that you have learned in this campaign to find success in your future battles, and remember that it is better to be feared than loved. - Machiavelli (The Prince 1513)

achievement.name: El Dorado Campaign Completed
achievement.description: Orellana and his loyal followers faced more than their own fears and superstitions on their navigation of the Amazon. To overcome the adversity that stood in their way, they had to work as a unit and not as individuals. Remember those principles of unity and selflessness on your future campaigns.

achievement.name: Prithviraj Campaign Completed
achievement.description: The subject of veneration of many of his descendants, Prithviraj was shrewd, brave, honest, but also prone to emotion, taking many risks for the sake of love. Even in the sight of war and possible death, remember to enjoy your life to the fullest, for you only live once. A complete and moral life deserves the most remembrance.

achievement.name: Battles of the Forgotten Campaign Completed
achievement.description: Through your inquiry into the detail of some of the less-known but equally significant historical clashes of arms, you have shown that you are truly a master of the pen and the sword. Rule with the strength of the sons of Ragnar, the diplomatic aptitude of Khosrau Anushirvan, the steadfastness of Minamoto no Yoritomo, and the charisma of Osman Ghazi.

achievement.name: Master of the Forgotten World
achievement.description: You have successfully completed all of the story campaigns of Age of Empires II: The Forgotten Expansion. Through your trials and successes in these clashes of arms, you surely have mastered all spheres of empire-building and rule, and are ready to start building your own legend. “Cattle die, kindred die, every man is mortal: But the good name never dies of one who has done well.” -Havamal (Poetic Edda 1220)

achievement.name: Nightmare Winter Wonderland
achievement.description: You survived the onslaught of the Holiday Guardians... on Nightmare!

achievement.name: Playin' Anticupid
achievement.description: You successfully prevented hordes of mob matches in the Temple O' Love!

achievement.name: Nightmare Playin' Anticupid
achievement.description: You successfully prevented hordes of mob matches in the Temple O' Love... on Nightmare!

achievement.name: Tinkerer's Defender
achievement.description: You Defended the Tinker's Lab and cleared the way for EV's upgrade!

achievement.name: Nightmare Tinkerer's Defender
achievement.description: You Defended the Tinkerer's Lab and cleared the way for EV's upgrade... on Nightmare!

achievement.name: EV Reprogrammer
achievement.description: You assaulted the Lab and eliminated the squad of corrupted EV's!

achievement.name: Nightmare EV Reprogrammer
achievement.description: You assaulted the Lab and eliminated the squad of corrupted EV's... on Nightmare!

achievement.name: The Entity
achievement.description: What is the entity?

achievement.name: Elite
achievement.description: Make a 6 star system.

achievement.name: Supremacy
achievement.description: As a star have an orbiting life planet with 100 kills.

achievement.name: Asteroid Nursery
achievement.description: Have 15 asteroid moons around your planet.

achievement.name: Overcrowding
achievement.description: Get the maximum possible life in your system.

achievement.name: Super Clock
achievement.description: Get 10 planets in your system orbiting clockwise.

achievement.name: Betrayal
achievement.description: Grow to a black hole from a multi star system.

achievement.name: Flying Blind
achievement.description: Go from a small black hole (<150k mass) to Big Crunch without the interface visible.

achievement.name: Speed Cycle
achievement.description: Go from Big Bang to Big Crunch in under 20 minutes. No menu respawning.

achievement.name: Gentle But Firm
achievement.description: Complete the 2nd part of the "Fine Art" mission without dying and without evolved life on your planet.

achievement.name: Ninja
achievement.description: Complete each of the "Assassin" mission parts without dying.

achievement.name: I Got This
achievement.description: Kill all the attacking ships in the first part of the "Heist" mission before completing it.

achievement.name: Hobo Star
achievement.description: Start the 3rd part of the "Duel" mission as a single star with no planets and beat it in under 3 minutes.

achievement.name: I'm Late!
achievement.description: Complete the first part of the "Concert" mission in under 1 minute.

achievement.name: Planetary Soloist
achievement.description: Complete the second part of the "Concert" mission with no evolved life on your planet.

achievement.name: Why did you kill me?
achievement.description: Why?

achievement.name: Get Lost
achievement.description: Get Lost.

achievement.name: Grind Star
achievement.description: Make a 40 star system.

achievement.name: Dude, I Don't Suck!
achievement.description: Beat all the missions without using Physics or God options.

achievement.name: Dark Champion
achievement.description: Beat the final boss as a dark matter star without using Physics or God options.

achievement.name: Master Thief
achievement.description: Steal 10 planets on the "Planet Stealer" challenge mission.

achievement.name: Challenge Novice
achievement.description: Complete every challenge mission with any score.

achievement.name: Challenge Pro
achievement.description: Complete every challenge mission with a hard level score.

achievement.name: Snowflake Star
achievement.description: Get 4 points in the star challenge mission "Snowball Fight".

achievement.name: We Got the Megatome
achievement.description: Retrieve the burdensome book of sinister sworcery from the darkness beneath Mingi Taw.

achievement.name: The Ballad of the Space Babies
achievement.description: Summon a slumbering sylvan sprite & send it skyward.

achievement.name: The Gold Trigon
achievement.description: Tame the cosmic geometry of The Gold Trigon in a sunlit meadow where angry bird sculptures loom.

achievement.name: The Dark Moon Trigon
achievement.description: Despite everything, tame the Dark Moon Trigon in a rain-soaked forest during a storm of thunder & lightning.

achievement.name: Assemble the Trigon Trifecta
achievement.description: Complete the three trigons in The Dark Moon Rock Show.

achievement.name: #honest
achievement.description: Complete the Scythian's woeful errand without cheating.

achievement.name: Monster Hunter
achievement.description: Find & somehow slay at least 7 lagomorphs, you jerk.

achievement.name: The Grizzled Boor
achievement.description: Feel free to take this opportunity to secretly self-identify as a principled, loving individual or a violent psychopath.

achievement.name: The Mushroom Kingdom
achievement.description: Experience the strange insight offered by a divinatory mushroom.

achievement.name: Cheating Cheater
achievement.description: Adjust your computer's date/time settings to access other moon phases & thus feel profound shame.

achievement.name: #moar
achievement.description: It has been said that something lurks within the White Stag of Scythia, wherever/whenever/whatever that might be.

achievement.name: The Moon Grotto
achievement.description: Use the Grizzled Boor's key to open the locked door to you-know-where.

achievement.name: The Bright Moon Trigon
achievement.description: Be awesome, get the Bright Moon Trigon from beneath an impossible island in the centre of a placid lake.

achievement.name: Now We Are Cosmic Friends Forever
achievement.description: Upload the Megatome at the summit of Mingi Taw & complete the Scythian's woeful errand.

achievement.name: Plot Matters
achievement.description: Beat story mode with all characters.

achievement.description: Play 500 ranked matches.

achievement.description: Win a ranked match without using any special moves.

achievement.name: Perfection
achievement.description: Beat story mode using the YOLO gem.

achievement.description: Knock out an opponent who is in Kickfactor while you are concussed in a ranked match.

achievement.name: I Have My Reasons

achievement.description: Play 2000 ranked matches.
